top_articles.title: New Chrome Zero-Day (CVE-2026-2441) Under Active Attack — Patch Released
top_articles.summary: Google on Friday released security updates for its Chrome browser to address a security flaw that it said has been exploited in the wild.  The high-severity vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-2441  (C

top_articles.title: Google Patches First Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2026
top_articles.summary: A Chrome 145 update fixes CVE-2026-2441, a vulnerability that can likely be exploited for arbitrary code execution.

top_articles.title: BeyondTrust Vulnerability Targeted by Hackers Within 24 Hours of PoC Release
top_articles.summary: Exploitation attempts target CVE-2026-1731, a critical unauthenticated remote code execution flaw in BeyondTrust Remote Support.

top_articles.title: CISA Warns of Exploited SolarWinds, Notepad++, Microsoft Vulnerabilities
top_articles.summary: Disclosed at the end of January, the SolarWinds vulnerability was likely exploited as a zero-day since December 2025.
